maml:description.maml:para: Exports M365 security audit results to a CSV file or outputs a specific test result as an object.

This function exports M365 security audit results from either an array of CISAuditResult objects or a CSV file. It can export all results to a specified path or output a specific test result as an object.
The test number to output as an object. Valid values are "1.1.1", "1.3.1", "6.1.2", "6.1.3", "7.3.4".
An array of CISAuditResult objects containing the audit results.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Switch to export all test results.
An array of CISAuditResult objects containing the audit results.
The path where the CSV files will be exported.
Switch to export the original audit results to a CSV file.
Switch to export the results to an Excel file.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The test number to output as an object. Valid values are "1.1.1", "1.3.1", "6.1.2", "6.1.3", "7.3.4".
The path to a CSV file containing the audit results.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Switch to export all test results.
The path to a CSV file containing the audit results.
The path where the CSV files will be exported.
Switch to export the original audit results to a CSV file.
Switch to export the results to an Excel file.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
An array of CISAuditResult objects containing the audit results.
The path to a CSV file containing the audit results.
The test number to output as an object. Valid values are "1.1.1", "1.3.1", "6.1.2", "6.1.3", "7.3.4".
Switch to export all test results.
The path where the CSV files will be exported.
Switch to export the original audit results to a CSV file.
Switch to export the results to an Excel file.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Export-M365SecurityAuditTable -AuditResults $object -OutputTestNumber 6.1.2 # Output object for a single test number from audit results

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Export-M365SecurityAuditTable -ExportAllTests -AuditResults $object -ExportPath "C:\temp" # Export all results from audit results to the specified path

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Export-M365SecurityAuditTable -CsvPath "C:\temp\auditresultstoday1.csv" -OutputTestNumber 6.1.2 # Output object for a single test number from CSV

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Export-M365SecurityAuditTable -ExportAllTests -CsvPath "C:\temp\auditresultstoday1.csv" -ExportPath "C:\temp" # Export all results from CSV to the specified path

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Export-M365SecurityAuditTable -ExportAllTests -AuditResults $object -ExportPath "C:\temp" -ExportOriginalTests # Export all results from audit results to the specified path along with the original tests

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Export-M365SecurityAuditTable -ExportAllTests -CsvPath "C:\temp\auditresultstoday1.csv" -ExportPath "C:\temp" -ExportOriginalTests # Export all results from CSV to the specified path along with the original tests

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves user licenses and roles for administrative accounts from Microsoft 365 via the Graph API.

The Get-AdminRoleUserLicense function connects to Microsoft Graph and retrieves all users who are assigned administrative roles along with their user details and licenses. This function is useful for auditing and compliance checks to ensure that administrators have appropriate licenses and role assignments.

A switch parameter that, when set, skips the connection to Microsoft Graph if already established. This is useful for batch processing or when used within scripts where multiple calls are made and the connection is managed externally.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

A switch parameter that, when set, skips the connection to Microsoft Graph if already established. This is useful for batch processing or when used within scripts where multiple calls are made and the connection is managed externally.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Get-AdminRoleUserLicense.
Returns a custom object for each user with administrative roles that includes the following properties: RoleName, UserName, UserPrincipalName, UserId, HybridUser, and Licenses.

maml:alert.maml:para: Creation Date: 2024-04-15 Purpose/Change: Initial function development to support Microsoft 365 administrative role auditing.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves all administrative role users along with their licenses by connecting to Microsoft Graph using the default scopes.
This example retrieves all administrative role users along with their licenses without attempting to connect to Microsoft Graph, assuming that the connection is already established.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication) status for Azure Active Directory users.

The Get-MFAStatus function connects to Microsoft Online Service and retrieves the MFA status for all Azure Active Directory users, excluding guest accounts. Optionally, you can specify a single user by their User Principal Name (UPN) to get their MFA status.
The User Principal Name (UPN) of a specific user to retrieve MFA status for. If not provided, the function retrieves MFA status for all users.
{{ Fill SkipMSOLConnectionChecks Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The User Principal Name (UPN) of a specific user to retrieve MFA status for. If not provided, the function retrieves MFA status for all users.
{{ Fill SkipMSOLConnectionChecks Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns a sorted list of custom objects containing the following properties:

maml:alert.maml:para: The function requires the MSOL module to be installed and connected to your tenant. Ensure that you have the necessary permissions to read user and MFA status information.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-MFAStatus Retrieves the MFA status for all Azure Active Directory users.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-MFAStatus -UserId "example@domain.com" Retrieves the MFA status for the specified user with the UPN "example@domain.com".

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes a security audit for Microsoft 365 environments.

The Invoke-M365SecurityAudit cmdlet performs a comprehensive security audit based on the specified parameters. It allows auditing of various configurations and settings within a Microsoft 365 environment, such as compliance with CIS benchmarks.
The URL of the tenant admin. If not specified, none of the SharePoint Online tests will run.
The domain name of the Microsoft 365 environment to test. This parameter is not mandatory and by default it will pass/fail all found domains as a group if a specific domain is not specified.
Specifies the E-Level (E3 or E5) for the audit. This parameter is optional and can be combined with the ProfileLevel parameter.
Specifies the profile level (L1 or L2) for the audit. This parameter is optional and can be combined with the ELevel parameter.
If specified, the cmdlet will not establish a connection to Microsoft 365 services.
If specified, the cmdlet will not disconnect from Microsoft 365 services after execution.
If specified, the cmdlet will not check for the presence of required modules.
If specified, the cmdlet will not prompt for confirmation before proceeding with established connections and will disconnect from all of them.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The URL of the tenant admin. If not specified, none of the SharePoint Online tests will run.
The domain name of the Microsoft 365 environment to test. This parameter is not mandatory and by default it will pass/fail all found domains as a group if a specific domain is not specified.
If specified, includes tests where IG1 is true.
If specified, the cmdlet will not establish a connection to Microsoft 365 services.
If specified, the cmdlet will not disconnect from Microsoft 365 services after execution.
If specified, the cmdlet will not check for the presence of required modules.
If specified, the cmdlet will not prompt for confirmation before proceeding with established connections and will disconnect from all of them.

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

The domain name of the Microsoft 365 environment to test. This parameter is not mandatory and by default it will pass/fail all found domains as a group if a specific domain is not specified.
If specified, includes tests where IG2 is true.
If specified, the cmdlet will not establish a connection to Microsoft 365 services.
If specified, the cmdlet will not disconnect from Microsoft 365 services after execution.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Invoke-M365SecurityAudit.
The cmdlet returns an array of CISAuditResult objects representing the results of the security audit.

maml:alert.maml:para: - This module is based on CIS benchmarks.
- Governed by the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

- Register for CIS Benchmarks at: https://www.cisecurity.org/cis-benchmarks

dev:remarks.maml:para: Performs a security audit using default parameters. Output: Status : Fail ELevel : E3 ProfileLevel: L1 Connection : Microsoft Graph Rec : 1.1.1 Result : False Details : Non-compliant accounts: Username | Roles | HybridStatus | Missing Licence user1@domain.com| Global Administrator | Cloud-Only | AAD_PREMIUM user2@domain.com| Global Administrator | Hybrid | AAD_PREMIUM, AAD_PREMIUM_P2 FailureReason: Non-Compliant Accounts: 2

Performs a security audit for the E5 level and L1 profile in the specified Microsoft 365 environment. Output: Status : Fail ELevel : E5 ProfileLevel: L1 Connection : Microsoft Graph Rec : 1.1.1 Result : False Details : Non-compliant accounts: Username | Roles | HybridStatus | Missing Licence user1@domain.com| Global Administrator | Cloud-Only | AAD_PREMIUM user2@domain.com| Global Administrator | Hybrid | AAD_PREMIUM, AAD_PREMIUM_P2 FailureReason: Non-Compliant Accounts: 2

Performs an audit including all tests where IG1 is true. Output: Status : Fail ELevel : E3 ProfileLevel: L1 Connection : Microsoft Graph Rec : 1.1.1 Result : False Details : Non-compliant accounts: Username | Roles | HybridStatus | Missing Licence user1@domain.com| Global Administrator | Cloud-Only | AAD_PREMIUM user2@domain.com| Global Administrator | Hybrid | AAD_PREMIUM, AAD_PREMIUM_P2 FailureReason: Non-Compliant Accounts: 2

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-M365SecurityAudit -TenantAdminUrl "https://contoso-admin.sharepoint.com" -M365DomainForPWPolicyTest "contoso.com" -SkipRecommendation '1.1.3', '2.1.1' Performs an audit while excluding specific recommendations 1.1.3 and 2.1.1. Output: Status : Fail ELevel : E3 ProfileLevel: L1 Connection : Microsoft Graph Rec : 1.1.1 Result : False Details : Non-compliant accounts: Username | Roles | HybridStatus | Missing Licence user1@domain.com| Global Administrator | Cloud-Only | AAD_PREMIUM user2@domain.com| Global Administrator | Hybrid | AAD_PREMIUM, AAD_PREMIUM_P2 FailureReason: Non-Compliant Accounts: 2

dev:remarks.maml:para: Captures the audit results into a variable and exports them to a CSV file. Output: CISAuditResult[] auditResults.csv
Displays what would happen if the cmdlet is run without actually performing the audit. Output: What if: Performing the operation "Invoke-M365SecurityAudit" on target "Microsoft 365 environment".

maml:description.maml:para: Removes rows from an Excel worksheet where the 'CSV_Status' column is empty and saves the result to a new file.

The Remove-RowsWithEmptyCSVStatus function imports data from a specified worksheet in an Excel file, checks for the presence of the 'CSV_Status' column, and filters out rows where the 'CSV_Status' column is empty. The filtered data is then exported to a new Excel file with a '-Filtered' suffix added to the original file name.
The path to the Excel file to be processed.
The name of the worksheet within the Excel file to be processed.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The path to the Excel file to be processed.
The name of the worksheet within the Excel file to be processed.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires the ImportExcel module to be installed.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Remove-RowsWithEmptyCSVStatus -FilePath "C:\Reports\Report.xlsx" -WorksheetName "Sheet1" This command imports data from the "Sheet1" worksheet in the "Report.xlsx" file, removes rows where the 'CSV_Status' column is empty, and saves the filtered data to a new file named "Report-Filtered.xlsx" in the same directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Synchronizes and updates data in an Excel worksheet with new information from a CSV file, including audit dates.

The Sync-CISExcelAndCsvData function merges and updates data in a specified Excel worksheet from a CSV file. This includes adding or updating fields for connection status, details, failure reasons, and the date of the update. It's designed to ensure that the Excel document maintains a running log of changes over time, ideal for tracking remediation status and audit history.
Specifies the path to the Excel file to be updated. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies the path to the CSV file containing new data. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies the name of the worksheet in the Excel file where data will be merged and updated. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specifies the path to the Excel file to be updated. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies the path to the CSV file containing new data. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies the name of the worksheet in the Excel file where data will be merged and updated. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: The function accepts strings for file paths and worksheet names.
The function directly updates the Excel file and does not output any objects.

maml:alert.maml:para: - Ensure that the 'ImportExcel' module is installed and up to date to handle Excel file manipulations.
- It is recommended to back up the Excel file before running this function to avoid accidental data loss.
- The CSV file should have columns that match expected headers like 'Connection', 'Details', 'FailureReason', and 'Status' for correct data mapping.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Sync-CISExcelAndCsvData -ExcelPath "path\to\excel.xlsx" -CsvPath "path\to\data.csv" -SheetName "AuditData" Updates the 'AuditData' worksheet in 'excel.xlsx' with data from 'data.csv', adding new information and the date of the update.
